result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lassana Sissoko

records.addlTxt: The Court INCREASES Justice Point SUPERVISION to Level 5.   The Court ordered defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  The Court ordered defendant to undergo random urine screens, drug tests and breathalyzer test. No possession of firearms or dangerous weapons.  The Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Lassana Sissoko in court.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Lassana Sissoko.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea and Sentencing hearing.  Parties have reached an agreement and will proceed with plea hearing only. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1 : Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, body armor, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Court does not remand the Defendant into custody, but ORDERS the Defendant turned over to Justice Point with Level 5 Supervision, with conditions. Parties shall file any character letters at least 3 days prior to the sentencing hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 9 for Sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
and Addendum to Plea and Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, signed in court by the Defendant, and filed.

Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Lassana Sissoko.  Defendant Lassana Sissoko appeared by video. Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Pretrial conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests a Plea and Sentencing date be scheduled. Case adjourned to Br 9. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter calendared for 11:30 am this morning for a Pretrial conference.  Defendant was present, but Counsel was held up in another court. Case passed to the afternoon. Defendant advised he need not appear in the afternoon and would be advised of next hearing date by counsel.

Defense has discovery and an offer from the state.  Defendant allowed to appear via zoom for next hearing. 

Matter adjourned to Br. 9 for Adjourned pretrial conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lassana Sissoko in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court sets 07/01/2022 as the deadline for the State to provide all of the discovery with the exception of crime lab reports to the Defense. Court sets 08/08/2022 as the deadline to file any motions or change of plea forms.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Lassana Sissoko in court with attorney Fred Richardson, appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Glendale Officer J.Byrnes.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lassana Sissoko in court.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for status. Defendant is no longer in custody and is present in person. Attorney Richardson is in trial. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court, defendant Lassana Sissoko not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant is currently in custody in Iowa. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Lassana Sissoko in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Lassana Sissoko in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lassana Sissoko appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
